hypothesis_content.title: SOL Volatility Surge Following Low Volume Bull Regime Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: In a BULL regime, when SOL price breaks above its 20-day high on below-average volume (volume < 20-day median), a subsequent surge to a new 10-day high within 2 days will trigger elevated 3-day forward volatility ( > 1.5x the 10-day pre-breakout volatility), creating a long volatility opportunity.
hypothesis_content.rationale: A low-volume breakout suggests weak consensus and potential for a 'throwback' or violent continuation as late participants rush in. The second higher high confirms momentum but often occurs with increasing disagreement, elevating volatility. Bull regimes provide the underlying bid to support the move.
entry_conditions: Volume on breakout day < 20-day median volume
SOL price then makes a new 10-day high within the next 2 trading days

exit_conditions.take_profit: 3 trading days after the second breakout (10-day high)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price falls below the initial 20-day breakout level

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: 3-day realized volatility following the second breakout is not significantly greater than the 10-day volatility prior to the initial breakout (threshold: 1.5x).
